channel.title: CVE Feed for WebAccess -- WebAccess/SCADA
channel.description: The latest CVEs for WebAccess -- WebAccess/SCADA

item.title: CVE-2019-10991|2024-08-04T22:40:15.589Z -- webaccess -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: In WebAccess/SCADA, Versions 8.3.5 and prior, multiple stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities are caused by a lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities may allow remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2019-10983|2024-08-04T22:40:15.527Z -- webaccess -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: In WebAccess/SCADA Versions 8.3.5 and prior, an out-of-bounds read vulnerability is caused by a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data. Exploitation of this vulnerability may allow disclosure of information.

item.title: CVE-2019-10993|2024-08-04T22:40:15.647Z -- webaccess -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: In WebAccess/SCADA Versions 8.3.5 and prior, multiple untrusted pointer dereference vulnerabilities may allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2019-10989|2024-08-04T22:40:15.634Z -- webaccess -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: In WebAccess/SCADA Versions 8.3.5 and prior, multiple heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities are caused by a lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities may allow remote code execution. Note: A different vulnerability than CVE-2019-10991.

item.title: CVE-2019-10985|2024-08-04T22:40:15.691Z -- webaccess -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: In WebAccess/SCADA, Versions 8.3.5 and prior, a path traversal vulnerability is caused by a lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to use in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to delete files while posing as an administrator.

item.title: CVE-2019-10987|2024-08-04T22:40:15.688Z -- webaccess -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: In WebAccess/SCADA Versions 8.3.5 and prior, multiple out-of-bounds write vulnerabilities are caused by a lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities may allow remote code execution.
